course.subject: LANG
course.name: English for Chemistry Capstone Projects
course.description: The course focuses on developing Chemistry students' ability to use effective and appropriate organizational structures, vocabulary, language and style in Capstone Project reports and presentations.
course.corequisites: CHEM 4689 OR CHEM 4691 OR SCIE 3500 OR SCIE 4500

reviews.author: 燃燒中的GPA
reviews.title: 我知呢個course已經摺左,純粹俾d分大家參考
reviews.comment_content:
呢個course 原本suppose係幫你個FYP既, 結果係越幫越忙

有堂instructor問大家覺得自己寫research report定係做oral presentation無信心d, 大部分人 (包括我) 都話係oral presentation, 結果成個sem淨係得2堂係教presentation skills + 1堂做一個3-min practice (唔關你個FYP事, 唔計分), 其餘時間都係教寫research report, 根本就無照顧到同學既學習需要

Student Notes又係咁, 6個units淨係得1個教presentation skills, 其餘5個全部都係教寫research report既

好消息係, 呢個course已經壽終正寢, “the course is dead”
reviews.comment_teaching:
其實佢份人就無咩野既, 只係佢expect 你上堂果陣要有active participation, 成日叫你做下discussion咁, 上親LANG堂都要扮專心扮積極係基本常識黎

佢無science background就係人都知, 你present果陣講錯d academic野佢都應該唔會知, 唔好學某d professor咁 present到1999就得
reviews.comment_grading:
10% Participation (更正返其他人既review, 呢個course 1個禮拜得1堂, 成個sem 得果12/13堂, 邊有得俾你走6堂咁筍呀? 最多俾你走2堂咋)
45% Written Research Report
45% Oral Presentation

出完grade先再出分, 你見過未? 我見過, 我真係見過

真係好好笑, 佢出完grade 之後十幾日無端端send 封email黎話可以返去攞返張分紙, 果時放緊study break, 我心諗你地唔係有個CLE Feedback System可以網上出分出comment架咩?

成個sem辛苦左咁耐, 我都想知自己幾多分, 於是唯有返去攞

Written Research Report: 6/5.5/6 (=17.5/21)
Oral Presentation: 5.5/5.5/5 (=16/21)

Grade: B+
reviews.comment_workload: CHEM同LANG兩邊個requirements唔同, 例如CHEM FYP Presentation係10 mins, LANG 係 8 mins, 所以要整2個唔同version既PPT 各取所需 (解釋Chem俾d本身識Chem既人要10 mins, 解釋俾d本身唔識Chem既人淨係俾得果8 mins, 成件事都幾荒謬)

reviews.author: Brownpanda
reviews.title: Useless
reviews.comment_content: 教ge內容完全無用，完全係一個負擔，係咁忙ge final year仲要為咗依個course煩。交ge report, presentation同capstone要求ge完全兩回事，所以好多人都因為咁要寫份report，整兩個powerpoint

其實佢人唔差，但就真係完全教唔到嘢，佢唔明做research係乜嘢，淨係會跟住本書讀，問題係佢會堅持要我哋跟書，但其實唔係份份report都有咩impact, application，好似佢會覺得要影響到社會個啲先叫impact，逼我地吹一啲impact出嚟去滿足佢個requirement。而且fyp係為咗畢業而做，所以冇咩significant results都唔出奇，但佢就完全理解唔到。再嚟就係你要解釋啲好簡單ge嘢俾佢聽，例如periodic table, oxidation state，因為佢完全冇science底。
總結一句就係，ust揾個冇寫過research paper，甚至可能冇睇過research paper ge人嚟教你寫research paper。
reviews.comment_grading:

reviews.author: Fickdeinemutter
reviews.title: Worse Than Nothing
reviews.comment_content:
Taught us how to write “academically” in a science research project, by a tutor who is an arts' graduate.

Messy & meaningless black & white powerpoint slides, repeating virtually the same things from LANG 1003 two & a half years ago, except for the absence of social issues.

I heard that the school was going to cancel this course next year.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I'm afraid that this tutor, who is an arts' graduate, knows very little about science & how lab & research reports are actually written. She wasn't even quite clear about what she was teaching & constantly asked us for instructions.

She tried to teach us how to do a “successful” presentation, but she was the one whose presentation skills were the most doubted.

She provocatively opened the course outline whenever some of us fell asleep to “show” us how much “participation” worth. I understand that class participation is our duty. It's not we who disregard your lessons, but your lessons are not that helpful & worthwhile to us.  

Most of us only want to complete the degree & get a certificate. I'm sad that you've expected too much from us.

Also, her instructions were vague. Initially, she said that the research report for her course had to be “different” from the one we submitted to our Capstone course without specification.

It wasn't until November she suddenly realized that the report to be submitted to her was to be the same as that to be submitted to our Capstone course.
reviews.comment_grading:
She said she would give feedback. I've received none but a B- on SIS. I don't know how this grade came. I would not call it bad as I reckon B- is “average” at UST.

Presentation (45%)
Research Report (45%)
Participation (10%)

Missing >6 lessons → FAIL

reviews.author: YSA
reviews.comment_content:
The course is supposed to help with the report and presentation for the FYP, but it's not very useful unless you have never written a report or given a presentation before.

The FYP grading is mostly based on the content, this course is all about language, structure, organization. Also some FYP don't have presentations, but this course has report + presentation, so that's useless.

Overall it's a waste of time and does not help with the FYP. Most of the content is repeated from previous 2000 and 3000-level LANG courses.
reviews.comment_teaching: Lessons are mostly boring and too long (1 hour 50 minutes each week). There is very little content, it can easily be covered in a 50 minute lecture every week.
reviews.comment_grading:
Report: 45%
Presentation: 45%
Participation: 10%

Got 21/21 in the report, and 20.5/21 in the presentation. But still final grade is A. I don't think there is an A+.
reviews.comment_workload:
8-minute presentation and a report. They are the same as for FYP, so most of it can be repeated in this course. But too much workload for a 2-credit course.

80% attendance required.

reviews.author: KARENLAI
reviews.comment_content:
Content for fitting the CHEM4689/4691 courses in writing lit reviews or research paper.
Mainly teach you about how to write reports with good introduction, citing methods, conclusion, abstract and make a good presentation with strong influences to the audience.
reviews.comment_teaching: Using the files made by the course instructors. Fair, but instructor does not have science background so you have to be ready to explain difficult concepts to her in a creative and easy way
reviews.comment_grading: Without active participation, I got A with full marks in the report (7/7/7) and 7/5.5/6 in the presentation. It is generally good for me to gain some credits, yet, some students said they did not receive positive feedback as they wished.
reviews.comment_workload: Not heavy, just 1 presentation (6-8 mins) and 1 report (the same as the one for Capstone); some activities for practice, like public speaking for 2 mins.

reviews.author: EdogawaC
reviews.title: If you are fortunate enough to get Reb, you will have a great course!
reviews.comment_content:
Similar to lang 3012, but focus is put into writing intro, abstract and discussion. Conclusion and experimental not covered because they are virtually the same as writing lab report. Since this course is about writing a good research report, a lot of attention is directed towards analyzing segments of research articles and identifying common elements in each section of a report. The balance between conciseness and engaging the reader is also emphasized.
the other important focus of the course is to improve presentation skills. we had a ton of class practices, mostly just casual chat or reflections from what we just learnt in class. Reb made sure we develop our communication techniques by encouraging us to talk louder/ have a good posture etc. We also had a practice 2 min presentation on a self-selected topic, and the feedback from classmates as well as Reb were very helpful.
reviews.comment_teaching:
same with 3012, Reb is just an amazing instructor. If not for her, I would hate to have 10 straight days of 2 hour lectures in july. I enjoyed every moment of class, and I really retain what I have learnt in class.
11/10
reviews.comment_grading:
45% each for report and 6-8 min presentation. rest is from class participation.
same with her 3012 class, you put effort into it, you get good grades out of it.
report 20.5/121; presentation 20.5/21. Grade not known yet

Reb gave us feedback for our reports right after we had our presentations. We did not just have timely feedback, we get invaluable feedback!!! Comments on what we do well and what we can improve in presentation is also given right after presentation day, allowing us to have ample time to practice for Chem presentation.
reviews.comment_workload: Slightly heavier workload, but very reasonable. If you start planning early for report, it will be a breeze. Some ungraded written/reading homework, but they help you improve rather than make you wish you have access to homework bots.
